node.title: Court blocks bid to release secret Ben Roberts-Smith report
node.alt: A man in a suit looking down
node.description: A secret Channel Seven legal report that "summarises all of the known rumours and allegations" about war veteran Ben Roberts-Smith will remain private after a court ruling today.
node.content: ["A Channel Seven legal report that \"summarises all of the known rumours and allegations\" about war veteran Ben Roberts-Smith will remain private, after a court ruling today.", "Mr Roberts-Smith is suing The Age, Federal Capital Press and Fairfax Media, which reported serious allegations against him, including multiple unlawful killings in Afghanistan, which he denies.", "In the Federal Court today, Justice Wendy Abraham dismissed the application made by Nine newspapers to gain access to an investigative journalist's report completed for Channel Seven, ruling the document was produced for legal purposes.", "According to court documents, in mid-2017, Seven West Media commercial director Bruce McWilliam requested a report be prepared for him and boss Kerry Stokes to examine the \"rumours and allegations\" about Mr Roberts-Smith and \"to investigate and check them out\".", "At the time, Mr Roberts-Smith was employed by Seven West Media\u00a0and has since stepped aside as the boss of the network's Queensland operations.", "Court documents reveal Mr McWilliam suggested to the former soldier\u00a0that Gold Walkley-winning investigative journalist Ross Coulthart prepare the report, to help him understand his \"rights and obligations\", consider his position regarding defamation, and prepare for the prospect of giving evidence at the Brereton Inquiry.", "Mr Coulthart's report was completed in 2018, and media releases were subsequently drafted.", "In August, Nine attempted to gain access to the documents by filing an interlocutory application that challenged claims they were covered by legal professional privilege \u2014 which protects all communications between a lawyer and client from being disclosed without the permission of the client.", "The newspapers' lawyers argued the report wasn't a document capable of attracting privilege, and the \"primary reason\" of its existence was \"the commercial and reputational concerns of Mr Stokes, and SWM [Seven West Media].\"\u00a0", "Nicholas Owens SC, the barrister for the publisher of two of the newspapers, previously characterised the report as a \"counter-investigation\".", "Today, Justice Abraham dismissed the application from the newspapers, saying she was \"satisfied\" the report was established for the dominant purpose of legal advice.", "Justice Abraham also noted that when the reporting was being completed, litigation was a\u00a0prospect, therefore strengthening the assumption that the report was for the purpose of legal advice.", "Privilege claims were also upheld on the draft media statements.", "The defamation trial has been delayed by COVID-19 concerns in NSW and will likely resume in the new year."]
